alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Chambers; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northwestern Bullock, Macon, southeastern Tallapoosa, southern Chambers and central Montgomery Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sturkie to near Franklin to Sprague. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Tuskegee, Valley, Lanett, Notasulga, Smiths, Milstead, Pike Road, Smiths Station, West Point, Shorter, Franklin, Waverly, Cusseta, Beulah, Lake Tuskegee, Shopton, Tuskegee National Forest and Beauregard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Bullock; Chambers; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa
